title: Triangle and anchor: Chelsea porcelain from the Williamsburg Collection
creator_credit: Gene Bjerke and Arthur L. Smith
brief_description: Traces the history of porcelain from China in the 9th century to Chelsea, England in the mid-eighteenth century. Discusses the various factory marks used on Chelsea porcelain and shows the development from simple white tableware to elaborately coloured and gilded dishes and figurines
